Reviews.Title: I do not recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: mckaylively
Reviews.Content: I purchased this looking for an inexpensive, small, lightweight camera to suppliment my Fujifilm camera.  I wanted something that was easy to stow in my pocket but still took good pictures.  I did find a small camera that was a perfect fit for any pocket (price wise and size wise, I must say), but that's about where the good ends.This camera has several modes that allow for the user to adjust picture settings, but after playing with all of them for a week and taking numerous pictures inside and outside with good light and low light, I didn't have one "good" picture.  By "good" I mean every picture turned out so fuzzy that I trashed them.  No matter what setting or light condition I took pictures in, I could not get a clear picture with this camera.  Every single shot came out fuzzy with dull colors.  Needless to say, I returned this camera.Yeah, this is a $50.00 camera, I know.  Still, though, I at least expected clear pictures.  What good is an 8 mp camera do if it doesn't take good pictures.The answer is no good at all.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy!
Reviews.Author: LovesAGoodBook "always looking for a good book"
Reviews.Content: My 6-year old twins received a Vivitar Vivicam as a birthday present.  It was awful!The camera takes lousy pictures (not one photo they tried to take came out clearly).  The SD card slot is open (there is no cover/protection).  The batteries have lasted for about 10 photos and now the camera will not even turn-on.  It has 1-star because 0 was not an option.
